SWIM.ConfigMenuHint: Click here for all the configuration options available in
SWIM.allowUserConfigName: Allow non-GM users SWIM config access:
SWIM.allowUserConfigHint: This setting allows non-GM users to access and edit the SWIM config window on actors and items.
SWIM.docReadHint: I hereby declare, that I have read the ReadMe and documentation as well as the dialogue on login about SWADE Immersive Macros (SWIM) and I may be struck by lightning if I lie.
SWIM.chaseDeckHint: This must be the exact name of the table that contains your chase cards for the Chase Setup Macro. This will be your default option, you can still choose another deck, but the one here will always be on top.
SWIM.injuryTableHint: Injury table used for Gritty Damage. You need to set up the EXACT name of your Injury Table. Gritty damage is only used for non-GM accounts.
SWIM.swdUnshakeHint: If activated, SWIM will use the unshake rules from SWD (raise required to act immediately, movement halved if Shaken) instead of SWADE.
SWIM.grittyDamageHint: Activate this if you want to use Gritty Damage. By default it only affects PCs.
SWIM.grittyDamageNPCHint: Activating this option will enable Gritty Damage for NPCs as well.
SWIM.fearTableHint: Fear table used for the Fear table macro. Please make sure to enter the EXACT name of your Fear table in here.
SWIM.healthPotionOptionsHint: A list of Health Potions common to your setting, seperated by a pipe ('|'). It must be EXACT names (it is also case sensitive), so check twice. Example: 'Health Potion|Minor Health Potion|Healing Potion'
SWIM.fatiguePotionOptionsHint: A list of Potions that cure Fatigue common to your setting, seperated by a pipe ('|'). It must be EXACT names (it is also case sensitive), so check twice. Example: 'Potion of Recreation|Minor Recreation Potion|Recreational Potion'
SWIM.natHeal_TimeHint: Here you can set up the time it takes until a Natural Healing roll may be done. You may not need to change this unless your setting rules state another interval. Default: five days
SWIM.shakenSFXHint: Sound effect (SFX) to be played when a token becomes Shaken.
SWIM.incapSFXHint: Sound effect to be played when a token becomes Incapacitated.
SWIM.stunSFXHint: Sound effect to be played when a token becomes Stunned.
SWIM.sfxDelayHint: This is t delay between certain sound effects in the Ammo Management macro. It is used to delay shot sounds when the amount of shots is 2 or 3 to simulate burst fire and Double Tap without the need to set up extra sound effects for those modes. You may need to experiment a bit. Performance heavily depends on hardware and numbers too low (below about 110) occasionally glitch. You should always use .ogg audio files to increase performance.
SWIM.npcAmmoHint: If enabled, NPCs require a fitting ammo item in their inventory in order to reload (or shoot weapons which do not require reload actions). If disabled NPCs have an infinite amount of ammo supply but still have a finite amount of shots in their weapon.
SWIM.woundedSFXHint: Sound effect to be played when a token takes a Wound.
SWIM.fatiguedSFXHint: Sound effect to be played when a token takes a level of Fatigue.
SWIM.fearSFXHint: Sound effect to be played on a roll on the Fear table.
SWIM.healSFXHint: Sound effect to be played when wounds are healed.
SWIM.looseFatigueSFXHint: Sound effect to be played when Fatigue is cured or removed.
SWIM.potionSFXHint: Sound effect to be played when a potion is ingested.
SWIM.shapeShiftSFXHint: The sound effect to be played when an actor shape changes.
SWIM.shapeShiftVFXHint: The visual effect to be played when an actor shape changes. I recommend Misty Step for everyone with access to the jb2a patreon module. Playing VFX requires Sequencer.
SWIM.chaseDeck-MaxCardsHint: The maximum number of cards for your layout. Default: 18
SWIM.chaseDeck-CardsPerRowHint: The Amount of Cards per row. Default: 9
SWIM.chaseDeck-CardsToDrawHint: The amount of cards you wish to draw by default. Default: 18
SWIM.chaseDeck-GridWithPixelsHint: The pixel width of your layouts scene. Default: 50
SWIM.chaseDeck-BorderHorizontalHint: The horizontal border (space) between cards. Default: 0
SWIM.chaseDeck-BorderVerticalHint: The vertical border (space) between cards. Default: 0
SWIM.chaseDeck-CardHeightHint: The card hight in grid squares. Default: 6
SWIM.chaseDeck-CardWidthHint: The card width in grid squares. Default: 4
SWIM.chaseDeck-DeckDownHint: The grid square on which the first card of the first row will be (measured from the top left corner of the scene, including padding). Default: 24
SWIM.chaseDeck-DeckRightHint: The grid square on which the first card of the first row will be (measured from the left border of the scene, including padding). Default: 10
SWIM.shapeChange-raiseScaleMultiplierHint: The multiplier used to apply to the token size on a Shape Change raise; must be a positive number between 0.10 and 5.00 (2 decimal places). This value should be higher than 1, since it represents a larger than normal effect. Default: 1
SWIM.defaultVolumeHint: The volume used by default to play the sound effects. Must be a number between 0 and 1. Currently individual sounds can't have another volume, this feature will be implemented at a later time.
SWIM.notification-selectSingleToken: Please select a single token first.
SWIM.notification-selectOneOrMoreTokens: Please select one or more tokens.
SWIM.notification-selectOrTargetOneOrMoreToke: Please select or target one or more tokens.
SWIM.notification-selectAndTargetOneToken: You must select a token and target another one.
SWIM.notification-selectOneAndTargetAnyNumber: Please select a token and target any number of other tokens.
SWIM.healVFXHint: The visual effect to be played when a token is healed. I recommend Healing Generic or Cure Wounds for everyone with access to the jb2a patreon module. Playing VFX requires Sequencer.
SWIM.notification-targetSingleToken: Please target a single token first.
SWIM.notification-noCommonBond: This character doesn't have the ability to give Bennies to others.
SWIM.dialogue-commonBond:
{officialClass}

You are about to give one Bennie from {tokenName} to {targetName}. Do you want to proceed?
SWIM.notification-noBenniesLeft: You have no more Bennies left.
SWIM.notification-noTokens: There are no tokens on the current scene that could partake in combat.
SWIM.combatSetupHint: Adds all appropriate tokens of the current scene to the combat tracker.
SWIM.combatPlaylistManagementHint: If set to true, the combat playlist below will start playing when combat is started. When the combat ends, the combat playlist will stop and all previous playlists will start playing again.
SWIM.combatPlaylistHint: This is the name of the playlist that starts playing when combat starts. Must be the exact name of the playlist, is case sensitive.
SWIM.noStopFolderName: Folder of playlists that don't stop:
SWIM.noStopFolderHint: You can specify a folder name (exact, not case sensitive) containing playlists that will never stop playing when combat starts.
SWIM.notification-noReloadableOrConsumableWea: You have no reloadable or consumable weapons.
SWIM.notification-noRequiredAmmoAvailable: You don't have the required ammo in your inventory.
SWIM.notification-outOfAmmo: You have no ammo left to reload this weapon.
SWIM.notification-cannotReloadConsumableWeapo: You cannot reload consumable weapons, please use Shooting instead.
SWIM.notification-cannotChangeAmmoTypeIfNPCDo: You cannot change ammo types on this weapon if NPCs don't use Ammo from their Inventory.
SWIM.notification-weaponAlreadyFull: The weapon is fully loaded already.
SWIM.chatMessage-shotsFired: {name} fires {shots} round(s) from a {itemWeaponName} and has {newCharges} left.
SWIM.chatMessage-shotsFiredWithCurrentAmmo: {name} fires {shots} {currentAmmo} round(s) from a {itemWeaponName} and has {newCharges} left.
SWIM.chatMessage-weaponUsed: {name} uses {shots} {itemWeaponName}(s) and has {newQuantity} left.
SWIM.chatMessage-shotsFiredWithCurrentAmmoNoR: {name} fires {shots} {currentAmmo} from a {itemWeaponName} and has {newCharges} left.
{name} fires {shots} {currentAmmo} from a {itemWeaponName}.
SWIM.chatMessage-reloadWeaponWithAmmoName: {name} reloads {pronoun} {itemWeaponName} with {itemAmmoName}.
SWIM.chatMessage-reloadWeaponWithoutAmmoName: {name} reloads {pronoun} {itemWeaponName}.
SWIM.chatMessage-unshakeResultNoShakenCannotA: and is no longer Shaken but cannot act this turn.
SWIM.chatMessage-unshakeResultNoShakenCanAct: , is no longer Shaken and may act normally.
SWIM.chatMessage-unshakeResultStillShaken: , is still Shaken, may only move at half pace but may take free actions.
SWIM.notification-critFailApplyWounds: You've rolled a Critical Failure! Applying wounds now...
SWIM.notification-critFailApplyFatigue: You've rolled a Critical Failure! Applying Fatigue now...
SWIM.dialogue-spendBennyText: Do you want to spend a Benny to act immediately? (You have {totalBennies} Bennies left.)
SWIM.dialogue-spentBennyToUnshake: {player} spent a Benny and {name} may act normally now.
SWIM.notification-warpgateRequired: Please install and activate Warp Gate to use this macro. See the console for more details.
SWIM.chatMessage-soakNoWounds: and is unable to soak any Wounds.
SWIM.chatMessage-soakAllWounds: and soaks all of his Wounds.
SWIM.dialogue-soakWoundsMainContent: You currently have {wv}/{wm} Wounds and {totalBennies} Bennies.
SWIM.dialogue-cannotUseMoreThanFourPP: You can't use more than 4 Power Points.
SWIM.dialogue-soakWoundsWithUnHolyWarriorCont:
You can spend a maximum of 4 Power Points to add a bonus to your Soaking Roll equal to the amount of Power Points used.
You have {ppv} Power Points left.
SWIM.dialogue-rerollText:
You've soaked {rounded} Wounds; you will receive {currWounds} Wounds.
Do you want to reroll your Soaking Roll (you have {totalBennies} Bennies left)?
SWIM.dialogue-outOfBenniesApplyWounds: You have no more Bennies, Wounds will be applied now.
SWIM.dialogue-outOfBenniesApplyFatigue: You have no more Bennies, Fatigue will be applied now.
SWIM.dialogue-incapacitationRollText:
You became incapacitated by damage.

You need to make an immediate Vigor roll. On a Critical Failure you will perish.
SWIM.dialogue-bleedingOutRollText:
You are Bleeding Out.

You need to make a Vigor roll each turn or minute while out of combat. On a Failure you will perish.
SWIM.dialogue.healOtherContent:
{officialClass}

Heal someone else.

You have targeted another token. Do you wish to heal that token?

If you wish to heal yourself instead, please remove the target.
SWIM.dialogue.healOtherSelect:
`${officialClass}

What was your result? Did you heal or remove fatigue

Note: If you had a Critical Failure on the healing or relief power you shouldn't be here. Only select Success or Raise if you used the power.

Important: You can use the Healing skill in combat to stabilise (remove Incapacitated and/or Bleeding Out). This takes one Action. If you do that please check the checkbox below.
SWIM.dialogue.healSelfContent:
{officialClass}

Heal yourself.

You have selected one token and may have targeted the same. This will only allow you to heal a token you own.

If you wish to heal someone else instead, please target another token but select yourself.
SWIM.notification.nothingToDo: There is nothing for you to do here.
SWIM.chatMessage-healOtherCritFailAndBleedOut: {tokenName} tried to heal {targetName} but failed miserably and made him/her Bleeding Out.
SWIM.chatMessage-healOtherCritFailAndIncap: {tokenName} tried to heal {targetName} but failed miserably and incapacitated him/her in the process.
SWIM.chatMessage-healOtherCritFailAndWound: {tokenName} tried to heal ${targetName} but failed miserably and applied another wound.
SWIM.chatMessage-healOtherRelief: {tokenName} gave {targetName} some relief by removing a level of Fatigue and/or Shaken.
SWIM.chatMessage-healOtherRaiseRelief: {tokenName} gave {targetName} some relief by removing up to two level of Fatigue and/or Shaken and/or Stunned.
SWIM.notification.generalErrorMsg: An error occured. See the console (F12) for more details.
SWIM.dialogue-noWoundsNorFatigue: You currently neither have any Wounds nor Fatigue. There is nothing for you to do here.
SWIM.dialogue-fatigueCheck:
You currently have no Wounds and {currentFatige}/{maxFatigue} Fatigue.

In general you may remove a level of Fatigue every hour when resting and the source of your Fatigue is absent. This can be altered depending on the source of Fatigue, so ask your GM if you're allowed to remove your Fatigue now.
SWIM.dialogue-hasFatiguePotion: You still have a potion that cures Fatigue, you might as well use it (but ask your GM, the source of your Fatigue might not allow it).
SWIM.dialogue-hasHealingPotion: You still have Healing potions, you might as well use one of these.
SWIM.dialogue-woundCheck:
You currently have {currentWounds}/{maxWounds} Wounds, no Fatigue and {totalBennies} Bennies.

You may make a Natural Healing roll every {natHeal_time} unless altered by setting specific circumstances.

You may also heal wounds directly (i.e. from the Healing Power).
SWIM.dialogue-fearContent:
{officialClass}

Please make sure that the cause of the fear is selected and that all tokens who failed their fear check are targeted.

The fear modifier detected on the selected token is {mod}.
You may adjust that number below (enter the total fear penalty as a positive number):
SWIM.notification.tableNotFound: Unable to locate '{tableName}'. Please import it into the world first.
SWIM.notification.tableNameMissing: Please set a {type} table name in the SWIM settings.
SWIM.notification.setupSWIMSummonCreature: Please import and set up the '[SWIM] Summon Creature' folder from the compendium first.
SWIM.dialogue-dismiss:
{officialClass}

Do you want to dismiss {name}? This can not be undone.
SWIM.shapeChange-numMorphsHint: The Shape Changer supports blending of the new token into the old one for a smooth transition. If you experience delays or performance issues or prefer a faster blending reduce this number. '0' will make the transition very fast without delays. Default: 50
SWIM.br2SupportHint: SWIM supports Better Rolls 2 for SWADE to add Sound Effects on certain functions (applying damage, unshaking and soaking damage). This setting enables these sound effects.
SWIM.lightSFXHint: The sound effect to be played when a light source is selected and applied in the Token Vision macro.
SWIM.effectBuilder-usePowerIconsName: Use power icon of caster in Effect Builder:
SWIM.effectBuilder-usePowerIconsHint: If checked, SWIM will use the power icon of the casters power (if found) as the icon for the active effect. Otherwise those icons provided by SWIM will be used.
SWIM.notification-selectSingleTargetMultiToke: Please select a single token and target one or more first.
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderContent:
{class}

Please select a power for more configuration options.

The selected token will be treated as the caster, the targeted tokens as the powers targets. Please target and select the caster if he is a recipient as well.

{text}
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderBoostLower: {allHTML}
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderProtection: {amountText}
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderSmite:
{allHTML}

{increaseText}
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderGrowth: Increase in Size steps:
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderShrink: Decrease in Size steps:
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderNothingElse: There is nothing more to do here.
SWIM.dialogue-powerEffectBuilderBurden:
This in- or decreases the carry weight die type without touching the Strength die type. Enter a value below; it's exact die steps so 1 would increase it from d6 to d8 for example.

Die type steps:
SWIM.notififaction.enterNumberUnequalZero: Please enter a number other than zero.
SWIM.ammoMgm-defaultSingleReloadHint: If enabled, the single reload checkbox in the ammo management will be checked by default.
SWIM.notification-noNeedToReload: This weapon does not require a reload action.
SWIM.noPowerPointsHint: This will change how effects are built in the Power Effect Builder. (Powers will get a near-infinite duration and the caster a -1 to the spellcasting roll if the power is found and has the skill in the power set up properly.)
SWIM.dialogue-takingInitiativeText: Do you want to act immediately (requires a successful opposed Athletics roll) or after the current combatant?
SWIM.ignoreShapeChangeSizeRuleHint: Enable this to ignore the characters rank when shape changing. The GM will always ignore the rank requirement, even if disabled.
SWIM.campfireImgOnHint: The texture for the lit campfire texture produced in the campfire builder.
SWIM.notification.critFailHarderToKillFail: You've rolled a Critical Failure and failed your {harderToKillName} roll! You will die now...
SWIM.notification.critFailHarderToKillSuccess: You've rolled a Critical Failure but made your {harderToKillName} roll! You will survive somehow...
SWIM.chat.critFailHarderToKillFail: {actorAlias} rolled a Critical Failure, didn't make the {harderToKillName} roll and perishes!
SWIM.chat.critFailHarderToKillSuccess: {actorAlias} rolled a Critical Failure, but made the ${harderToKillName} roll, is Incapacitated but survives, somehow.
SWIM.notification-adjustPaceDisabled: SWD unshake rules active, SWIM disabled the adjust Pace with Wounds setting.
SWIM.notification-bleedingRoll: {tokenName} bleeding out, please roll to avoid death.
SWIM.Config_SetAmmoActiveEffectHint: The ActiveEffect defined here will be used on the weapon once this ammo is loaded.
SWIM.Config_SFX: Sound Effects (SFX; leave empty for default)
SWIM.Config_ShakenSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this actor becomes Shaken or injured.
SWIM.Config_IncapSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this actor becomes Incapacitated.
SWIM.Config_UnshakeSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this actor becomes recovers from being Shaken.
SWIM.Config_SoakSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this actor successfully soaks wounds.
SWIM.Config_StunnedSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this actor gets Stunned.
SWIM.Config_FatiguedSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this actor gets gains Fatigue.
SWIM.Config_LooseFatigueSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this actor recovers Fatigue.
SWIM.Config_ReloadSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this weapon is reloaded.
SWIM.Config_FireSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this weapon is fired. This SFX is used multiple times when a burst or Fanning the Hammer is executed.
SWIM.Config_AutoFireSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this weapon shoots ten or more shots at once.
SWIM.Config_SilencedFireSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this weapon is shot with a suppressor (silencer) on. This SFX is used multiple times when a burst or Fanning the Hammer is executed while it is suppressed.
SWIM.Config_SilencedAutoFireSFXHint: The SFX to be played when this weapon is suppressed and shoots ten or more shots at once.
SWIM.Config_EmptySFXHint: The SFX to be played when this weapon is empty but tried to be fired regardless.
SWIM.Config_IsSilencedHint: Check this to mark the weapon as being suppressed (silenced).
SWIM.Config_LoadedAmmoHint: The currently loaded ammunition. This is set by the ammo management function in SWIM and usually doesn't need to be configured by the user.
SWIM.Config_IsConsumableHint: This marks a weapon as a consumable one. Consumable weapons do not reduce their ammunition on usage; instead the quantity is removed (used for throwing knives, grenades, etc.).
SWIM.Config_IsPackHint: This marks an item as a charge pack. Charge packs will always refill the entire weapon instead of a single shot (used for magazines, batteries, etc.).
SWIM.Config_RadResHint: You can specify a radiation resistance here. It may be negative for vulnerability to radiation.
SWIM.Config_PronounHint: Enter this actors pronoun here (usually 'his' or 'her'). If empty, SWIM will default to 'its' to fit most NPC monsters.
SWIM.Config_ButtonDisabled: Only available for items not owned by an actor.
SWIM.Option-automatic: Automatic -> | Automatic: The roll will automatically be made. |
SWIM.callbackModeHint: Determines if and how the SWIM functions to remove certain conditions (i.e. Shaken) should execute when the characters turn starts. Manual: A dialogue will ask for a roll. | Disabled: The system default rolls will be initiated (can be disabled in SUCC).
SWIM.fearResult-MarkOfFearDesc: You have faced something truly terrifying and from now on wear the mark of fear. A white strak in your hair or constantly twitching eyes or anything else you can think of. Change this description here in consultation of your Game Master and adjust the change you've gone through.
SWIM.chatMessage-heartAttackSuccessMessage: {name} was at the brink of death from a heart attack but survived and is Stunned.
SWIM.chatMessage-heartAttackFailureMessage: {name} is at the brink of death from a heart attack and will die in {rounds} rounds! A Healing roll at -4 might save {pronoun} sorry life.
SWIM.fearResult-PhobiaDesc: You have experienced something truly terrifying and from now on you live in constant fear of whatever you have faced. You may need to add the cause of this to the title of this hindrance and the created Active Effect to avoid confusion.
SWIM.chatMessage-panickedRollMessage: {name} is panicked and moves {pace}â€³ away from the cause.
SWIM.dialogue-FrightenedTitle: One or more tokens became frightened
SWIM.dialogue-FrightenedContent: Do you wish to remove the Frightened status of the following actors? (If you don't you'll have to do it manually later.)
SWIM.chatMessage-healOtherCureHeartAttack: {tokenName} saves {targetName} from dying of a heart attack. But {targetName} remains incapacitated. Any further healing rolls function normally.
SWIM.dialogue-convictionMaintenanceContent:
{officialClass}

You need to spend a Benny to maintain your conviction.
You have {currBennies} left. Do you wish to spend one?
SWIM.notification-noBenniesForConviction: You have no Bennies left to maintain your conviction.
SWIM.sceneIlluminationHint: Sets the default scenes illumination level.
SWIM.sceneIlluminationNotification: Illumination level for this scene updated.
SWIM.notification.monksTileTriggersNotFound: A campfire was placed. This works best with the Monks Active Tiles. See console (F12) for details.
SWIM.notification.campfireCreated: Campfire created. It can be put out by double clicking it.
SWIM.notification.notValidItem: The chosen item is not valid.
SWIM.blindModeHint: Here you can configure the visiual effects of the Blind power effect. 'No Effect' means tokens will retain their sight, 'Full Blind' will remove all vision from the token (which means the player won't be able to target). Both other options are suitable for tactic players, they will be able to target but won't be able to easily identify what they target.
SWIM.notification.shapeChangeOnOtherScene: {userName} requested a Shape Change on scene {sceneName}. Please move there and ask them to try again.
SWIM.dialogue-testerContent:
{officialClass}

Your target(s) will be tested, please select a Trait to roll the test with.
SWIM.notification.diseaseWarning: I feel sick, I should seek medical atention when this is over...
SWIM.chatMessage-radPoisoning-1: {actorName} is sick with radiation poisoning, a
SWIM.chatMessage-radPoisoning-2: {actorName} needs to roll Vigor at the start of each session. Radiation poisoning might be curable at the GMs discrection.
SWIM.chatMessage-wouldTakeFatigueFromSource: and would take a Level of Fatigue from {source}.
SWIM.dialogue-radiationCentre-2:
requires you to roll Vigor or you'll take 1 Level of Fatigue.

Instead you may choose to take the Level of Fatigue without a roll.
SWIM.dialogue-failedFatigueRoll-decisionFreeR:
You've failed your roll; you will receive 1 Level of Fatigue.

Do you want to use your free reroll?
SWIM.dialogue-failedFatigueRoll-decisionBenny:
You've failed your roll; you will receive 1 Level of Fatigue.

Do you want to reroll your Vigor Roll (you have {totalBennies} Bennies left)?

setting.name: Add Raise Calculator Button
setting.hint: Adds a Raise Calculator button to the Scene Control Buttons.
